nodes.title: About me
nodes.info1:
> My name is Mir Shahid Ali, 21 years old. I am pursuing an under graduate course in Electrical and Electronics Engineering at MVSR( Hyderabad, India).
I am a professional video editor who provides 1 free video edit to the client, upon satisfaction we continue else I would still learn from the opportunity and I am Content Creator on YouTube and Instagram.

> I was born and raised in Saudi Arabia, lived 18 years of my life experiencing all I could during which I represented CBSE Nationals(Table Tennis) thrice which was held in India.
I love video editing the most out of all the other things I enjoy such as vlogging, biking, playing Table Tennis, video games, spending time with friends. 
My goal is to do whatever makes me happy be it as simple as star gazing for the rest of my life because in the end that's all that matters if you are happy or not and it can be related by the quote "money cant buy happiness". It is true that money plays an important role in our life but what good is money when you are broken from within?  
I want to help people to realize what makes them truly happy and motivates them to keep moving forward.


> “"Mom, Arnie Welsh keeps calling me a geek. He says it like it's a bad thing. Is being a geek a bad thing?"

> "Of course not, Soda Pop. And don't listen to labels. They don't matter."

> "What are labels?"

> "It's an imaginary sticker people slap on you with the word they think you are written on it. It doesn't matter who they think you are. It matters who you think you are."

> "I think I might be a geek."

> She laughed. "Then you be a geek. Just be whatever makes you happy, Soda Pop, and I'll be happy too.”
― Samantha Young, Before Jamaica Lane
